How to Install ssg-debderived on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • ssg-debderived

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install ssg-debderived on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing ssg-debderived on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall ssg-debderived in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install ssg-debderived, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install ssg-debderived Using apt

To install ssg-debderived in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install ssg-debderived using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install ssg-debderived

The installation of ssg-debderived might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install ssg-debderived Using apt-get

To install ssg-debderived using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install ssg-debderived.

sudo apt-get -y install ssg-debderived

Install ssg-debderived Using Synaptic

To install ssg-debderived using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install ssg-debderived on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for ssg-debderived. This will display the ssg-debderived package in the package window, now to install ssg-debderived, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the ssg-debderived package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of ssg-debderived.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install ssg-debderived Using aptitude

To install ssg-debderived on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of ssg-debderived.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install ssg-debderived using the command aptitude install ssg-debderived.

sudo aptitude -y install ssg-debderived

How to Upgrade ssg-debderived on debian

If you want to upgrade the ssg-debderived package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade ssg-debderived using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade ssg-debderived to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade ssg-debderived.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade ssg-debderived sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade ssg-debderived

Upgrade ssg-debderived using Aptitude

To upgrade ssg-debderived using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade ssg-debderived.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade ssg-debderived

Upgrade ssg-debderived using Synaptic

To upgrade ssg-debderived using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for ssg-debderived, now right-click ssg-debderived, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade ssg-debderived just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall ssg-debderived on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall ssg-debderived from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just ssg-debderived, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove ssg-debderived

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of ssg-debderived

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of ssg-debderived you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge ssg-debderived

Remove ssg-debderived using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall ssg-debderived using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for ssg-debderived, right-click the ssg-debderived package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall ssg-debderived click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install ssg-debderived on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade ssg-debderived using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of ssg-debderived then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
